creator: japan-cars@bk.ru
text:
I tries to compile latest apache 2.0.48 from source on freebsd 4.8
bsd# ./configure --with-threads --with-mpm=perchild
bsd# make
but I have some errors. Please assist.


/bin/sh /root/src/httpd-2.0.48/srclib/apr/libtool --silent --mode=compile gcc -
g -O2 -pthread   -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -D_REENTRANT -D_THREAD_SAFE   -I../../include -
I../../include/arch -I../../include/arch/unix  -c thread_mutex.c && touch 
thread_mutex.lo
thread_mutex.c: In function `apr_thread_mutex_unlock':
thread_mutex.c:218: void value not ignored as it ought to be
*** Error code 1

Stop in /root/src/httpd-2.0.48/srclib/apr/locks/unix.
*** Error code 1

Stop in /root/src/httpd-2.0.48/srclib/apr/locks/unix.
*** Error code 1

Stop in /root/src/httpd-2.0.48/srclib/apr.
*** Error code 1

Stop in /root/src/httpd-2.0.48/srclib.
*** Error code 1

Stop in /root/src/httpd-2.0.48.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
Threads on BSD:

You must expect threaded Apache MPMs to fail in various on FreeBSD prior to 5.2
where you can use kse-based threads.

perchild MPM:

In case it isn't obvious, no Apache developers have done any work with perchild
in quite a long time, other than trying to keep perchild up to date with changes
that have been made to the other MPMs.  Please consider the current experimental
module  as a proving ground for some good ideas, but something that should be
left alone by folks not interested in debugging problems in it.

But the bug is an APR bug in the definition of atomic functions on FreeBSD, so
changing report as appropriate.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 26818 ***
creator: jorton@redhat.com
